intro: Fleurya caravellana, commonly known as the Caravellan fleurya, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent tubular corolla. Fleurya caravellana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
